flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator specializing in cybersecurity education, following university pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Generate high-quality flashcards for the topic: 'Initial Training for New Users' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Awareness and Training > Training Frameworks and Methodologies > Training Timing and Frequency > Initial Training for New Users). Consensus: 70% voter approval on completeness, pedagogy, etc. **Research Context (Completed/Expanded):** NIST SP 800-50 Rev. 1 'Building a Cybersecurity and Privacy Learning Program' (supersedes 2003 version): 5-step lifecycle - 1. Program management; 2. Framework (Awareness: concepts; Training: skills; Education: depth); 3. Implementation (initial new-hire orientation emphasized); 4. Assessment (metrics: tests, surveys, behavior); 5. Maintenance (frequency: initial + ongoing). Guidance: Deliver initial training during onboarding (first day/week) for cyber hygiene; address remote risks. Other: NICE Framework (entry-level TKS: threats, hygiene); Core Concepts: Awareness, Training, Hygiene, Security Culture, Risk Management. Big Picture: Initial training builds baseline for culture/risk mastery. Sources: NIST SP 800-50 Rev. 1 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-50r1.pdf); NIST SP 800-53 (AU-2 training); NICE Cybersecurity Workforce Framework (https://www.nist.gov/itl/applied-cybersecurity/nice). **Incorporate:** - Learning Objectives: [paste the 6 objectives above]. - Scaffolding Layers: [paste the 4 layers above]. - Active Learning Context: Flashcards should support discussion/problem-solving (e.g., timing debates, startup scenarios). **Task:** Generate 20-30 flashcards covering all objectives/layers (balanced). Use schema exactly. Vary types (Q&A, MCQ). Distractors: Plausible, misconception-based. Ensure web-grounded (NIST/NICE), measurable, optimized for spaced repetition/active recall. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcard objects.
